bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Samuel Taylor Darling, December 28, 1918

div1.p: [Carter] requests information on blood samples of yellow fever from Darling's work in Panama.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Samuel Taylor Darling, December 28, 1918
div1.p:
Can you give me any data on the blood picture of yellow fever
from your Panama experience? I do not remember that we made any
special study of it, but had there been marked deviation from
normal I judge we would have noted it and done so.

Dr. Souza called with your note when I was at Camp Lee:
came to see me again when I was in hospital--Hopkins. I returned
his call a few days ago, but did not find him in. I like what I
saw of him and will make it my business--if I have the luck to
really stay in Baltimore this winter--to make his acquaintance and
know him.
With best wishes to you and yours from each one of us .
